about:
Hi! I’m Sarthak Katiyar, a software developer and tech enthusiast. I’m currently pursuing my B.Tech in Computer Science and Business Systems at Vellore Institute of Technology (expected graduation: 2027).

I love learning by building, whether that’s coding projects, experimenting with new tools, or collaborating on ideas, these things excite me more than just books and lectures. I’m comfortable working both independently and in a team, though I prefer roles that offer a bit of both.

At the moment, I’m looking for internships and part-time remote opportunities that not only let me apply my skills but also give me an environment to keep growing as a developer and as a person. I’m especially drawn to opportunities where I can take ownership of my work, experiment, and learn along the way.

roles.title: Member — Natural Language Processing (NLP) Team
details: Worked in a research-focused team to test and evaluate various NLP models (LLaMA, Mistral, OpenAI, Gemini) on sarcasm detection.

roles.title: Member — Projects Team
details: Contributed as a technical member to the club website, including designing the Contact Us page.
Designed and presented two mini-game projects at the annual tech fest arcade stall.

roles.title: Member — Projects Team
details: Built a shell-based Python interpreter in C, applying concepts from Data Structures & Algorithms and Operating Systems coursework.

roles.title: Student to World Intern
details: Collaborated with international youth and experts to research cultural integration and human rights.
Contributed to designing accessible and interactive learning modules.

roles.title: Campus Ambassador
details: Supported the National Entrepreneurship Challenge (NEC 2024), helping VIT-AP secure a top 50 position.

roles.title: Research Team Lead
details: Led a research team, organizing study sessions and guiding peers in advanced algorithms, coding practices, and competitive programming.

projects.title: Terminal-based Python Interpreter using C
projects.description: A minimal Python interpreter built in C, simulating execution of basic Python commands in a terminal-like interface.

projects.title: Brick Breaker Game using PyGames
projects.description: A classic arcade-style game where the player controls a paddle to bounce a ball and break bricks, built using PyGame.

projects.title: Typing Test Game using HTML, CSS, and Javascript
projects.description: A web-based typing speed test application that measures words per minute and accuracy while typing random sentences.

projects.title: Terminal-based Wordle using Python
projects.description: A terminal-based Wordle clone where the player guesses a five-letter word, with hints for correct and misplaced letters.
